about.title: Our mission
about.title2: an artificial and ethical artificial intelligence
about.text1: As part of this naonedIA experience, as members of the collective, we came together to take part in this experience.With a collaborative work, we were able to create a real estate prediction tool.
about.text2: Having a willingness to share our knowledge, all our project is in OpenSource, if you are a student, teacher or just curious, you can look in detail at our work.We even encourage you to the challenger in order to be able to improve.

home.title: Housing experimentation
home.text: The objective of this project is to present the know-how of artificial intelligence in Nantes.This application is intended for all types of public.It allows to explain in a fun way the main principles to demystify the subject.
home.participate: Help us improve the prediction of our model.
home.estimate: Help us improve the prediction of our model.

estimate.poi: We are using points of interests to get the closest estimation for housing. We are NOT storing the location. This is only used to embed our data.

explain.step1: We start by recovering different datasets from different sources.
explain.step2: We start by analyzing them, examine their contents, analyze the available features.
explain.step3: Clean up the dataset by deleting duplicates, filling in missing data.
explain.step4: We enrich the dataset by combining it with others or by using various services.
explain.step5: We encode the dataset so that it is understandable for a computer.
explain.step6: We can now create different models using several algorithms.These algorithms perform their learning by ingesting the data prepared beforehand.
explain.step7: We analyze the results of different models with different tools, we can compare them.
explain.step8: We can deploy the model that seems the most adapted to the needs.

discover.title: Discover artificial intelligence
discover.explanation: Nowadays, we mainly use machine learning, the diagram below will show you the main algorithms used.

intelligence.title: What's intelligence ?
intelligence.explanation: The mental and cognitive abilities of an individual to solve a problem or to adapt to his environment.

learning.title: Learning?
learning.explanation2: The acquisition or modification of the representation of an environment to achieve effective interactions.
learning.explanation3: Make the right decision in a new situation.
learning.explanation4: Humans perform these tasks unconsciously, in real time and without explicit effort.

explanation1.title: A search algorithm?
explanation1.explanation: Represent knowledge in the form of graphs then search for a solution.In principle it is possible to calculate all the actions of the future and their consequences
explanation1.problem: However the number of possibilities explode exponentially

explanation2.title: A comparison?
explanation2.explanation: Memorize typical examples of the problem, compare an unknown object with the knowledge and find the nearest object.
explanation2.problem: There can be a lot of characteristics that influence or not the object to recognize

explanation3.title: Rules?
explanation3.explanation: Characterize things by rules, check if the rules apply to an unknown object.
explanation3.problem: The rules must be formulated by a specialist. It is difficult to cover all the exceptions. Incomplete or noisy objects will cause problems.

symbolic.title: Symbolic learning
symbolic.text: We use a symbolic representation (concepts), typically using a collection of rules, these rules are specified by a human, we use algorithms to combine rules and infer new knowledge.

statistic.title: Machine learning
statistic.text: We use a numerical representation (coding), we provide typical examples and the desired answer. The human specifies ‘what’ but not ‘how’, we use statistical learning algorithms.

supervised.title: Supervised
supervised.text: Each example is associated with a label, the purpose is to predict the label, so the system learns how to classify the data.

unsupervised.title: Unsupervised
unsupervised.text: The examples are not labeled, the goal is to find an existing typology characterizing the observations, the system learns a classification of the data.

reinforcement.title: Reinforcement
reinforcement.text: The examples are associated with a reward / punishment. The goal is to maximize the rewards. The system learns a decision policy.

result.title: Your estimation
result.text: Do you own the property? Help us improve, fill in the purchase price excluding notary fees.
result.textExplanation: Are you curious? Understand our estimated calculation:
